title: Hunt for man after woman is sexually assaulted down an alley on Sydney's Oxford Street
text:
An investigation has been launched after a woman was sexually assaulted down an alley way during a night out in Sydney.

The attack happened early Sunday morning after when the 22-year-old woman left a bar on Oxford Street in Surry Hills, after being separated from her friends.

While waiting outside, she was approached by a man and had a short conversation before walking off together.

He is described as being of Indian appearance, about 170cm tall, with a thin build, and was wearing a white t-shirt, dark-coloured long pants, and glasses

The woman alleges that she was sexually assaulted by a man in Turner Lane.

She contacted a friend before being admitted to Sutherland Hospital and reporting the incident to police.

Investigators released an image of a man they believe may be able to assist with inquiries.

He is described as being of Indian appearance, about 170cm tall, with a thin build, and was wearing a white t-shirt, dark-coloured long pants, and glasses.

Anyone who recognises this man is urged to contact detectives at Kings Cross Police Station or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
description: The attack happened early Sunday morning after when the 22-year-old woman left a bar on Oxford Street in Surry Hills, after being separated from her friends.
authors: Kelsey Wilkie For Daily Mail Australia
